Flows: A New Approach to UI Development (2018)

stories.text:
A buddy of mine and I have been hacking on an api for crypto called https://blocksend.co.

It's up and running and you can use it for all sorts of projects. One hack was allowing a web2 company to pay twitter followers with crypto from a dashboard, another was offering immediate washout on marketplaces.

To show other founders what we're up to with it, we've loaded up a couple hundred bucks on it, and you can withdraw just by entering your email or text at this link https://app.blocksend.co/hngiveaway.

And if you want any help integrating or getting a key, let us know!
stories.title: Show HN: Get $10 of crypto on us through our Blocksend API

stories.text:
Hi HN! I built a simple, fun and realtime app with Cloudflare, WebSockets and Redux because I've never used Cloudflare or WebSockets before and they sound pretty cool.

It uses Cloudflare Pages which offers a full stack deployment pipeline and Durable Objects for a realtime data store.

I also wrote about my experience and some tips if you're thinking about doing something similar.
stories.title: Show HN: Random Emojis – A live feed of emojis using Cloudflare and WebSockets
